Time and date services
[Platform abstraction]

Detailed Description

The time and date services are used to get and set host time-of-day and to format date/time values for output.

Define Documentation

#define IPDR_TIME_FORMAT_LENGTH   26
 

The maximum length of the buffer in the time string output functions.

Typedef Documentation

typedef char*(* IPDR_FormatTimeGMT_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg Arg, IPDR_Time Time, char *Buf)
 

Format a time into ISO format in the GMT (UTC) time zone.

Parameters:
Time seconds since "epoch" (1970-01-01T00:00:00 UTC (GMT))
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Buf The buffer to get the date/time C-string (must be IPDR_TIME_FORMAT_LENGTH bytes long or more).
Returns:
The formatted value (using Buf's space).

typedef char*(* IPDR_FormatTimeGMTNow_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg Arg, char *Buf)
 

Format the current time into ISO format in the GMT (UTC) time zone.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Buf The buffer to get the date/time C-string (must be IPDR_TIME_FORMAT_LENGTH bytes long or more).
Returns:
The formatted value (using Buf's space).
See also:
IPDR_FormatTimeGMT_t

typedef char*(* IPDR_FormatTimeSyslogNow_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg Arg, char *Buf)
 

Format the current time into syslog format. This formats the time according to RFC 3164, e.g.: "<code>Jul&nbsp;&nbsp;1&nbsp;17:23:47</code>".

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Buf The buffer to get the date/time C-string (must be IPDR_TIME_FORMAT_LENGTH bytes long or more).
Returns:
The formatted value (using Buf's space).

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_GetTime_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg Arg, IPDR_Time *Time)
 

Get the current time of day.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Time (output) seconds since "epoch" (1970-01-01T00:00:00 UTC (GMT))
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_SetTime_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg Arg, IPDR_Time Time)
 

Set the current time of day. It is allowed that this function fails, for example by not having sufficient permissions to set the time of day (the function is only used by some debug and testing functions).

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Time seconds since "epoch" (1970-01-01T00:00:00 UTC (GMT))
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_SleepMS_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg Arg, long Interval)
 

Sleep for a given number of milliseconds. If the system clock is not sufficiently precise, the time interval is rounded up to the precision of the clock.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Interval The number of milliseconds to sleep.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
